element.name: Phoenix Park - Park Gate & Lodge by Lahtac, Multi-cache (1/1)
element.description:
Dublin’s Phoenix Park is a treasure with more than 1700 acres
of walled parkland just 3km from the centre of the city.
At 707 hectares (1752 acres) is one of the largest enclosed
recreational spaces within any European capital city.

long-description.p:
There are some thirty-eight lodges with living accommodation
situated within Phoenix Park and no two dwellings are of the same
design.

The wall is itself designated as a protected structure and
stretches the entire way around the present-day park. It is eleven
kilometres long and three metres high. The wall also supports its
own particular flora.
The park is open all year round, there is no admission charge and
visitors can explore freely.

Bus Route(s): No's 10, 25, 37, 38, 39, 66, 67 from city
centre.

Each of the vehicular gates into Phoenix Park has a
gatekeeper’s lodge as part of the entrance cluster.

The cache is a magnetic nano container so BYOP. Please handle
container gently.
STAGE 1

Obtain the number engraved on the stonework over the front door
of the lodge.
ANSWER = ABCD
STAGE 2

Obtain the number engraved on the stonework over the front door
of this small building which was built as a GAOL for the
“Ladies of the Night” who frequented the area in olden
times. There are some cells submerged in the ground adjacant to
this building.

ul.li:
2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Found while out with Cristina. Took a bit of coaxing to get the log out of the cache, but luckily I have long nails. TFTC

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by Petr Skacha
TFTC

2010-06-10T19:00:00Z : Found it by medic143
I was appearing as a witness in a murder trial in the Central Ciminal Court and since I was a little early managed to snag this one before turning up at the appointed time. Took a while to extract it from the container, would recommend tweezers,
TNLN TFTC

2010-06-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by cheergu
Great park...I can't get over how HUGE it is! If you're going to do all the caches here you should definitely drive or rent a bike! Also, the park is always busy (it was pretty chilly when we were there and there were folks running, walking, playing cricket...) so you have to watch out for muggles. TFTC! CheerGU :)

2010-06-06T19:00:00Z : Found it by poohbear50
See GC284RJ Phoenix Park Ashdown lodge for our comments for this series. TFTC

wpt.name: GC27V18
wpt.desc: Phoenix Park - Park Gate & Lodge by Lahtac, Multi-cache (1/1)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Phoenix Park - Park Gate & Lodge
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description:
Dublin’s Phoenix Park is a treasure with more than 1700 acres
of walled parkland just 3km from the centre of the city.

At 707 hectares (1752 acres) is one of the largest enclosed
recreational spaces within any European capital city.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
There are some thirty-eight lodges with living accommodation
situated within Phoenix Park and no two dwellings are of the same
design.


The wall is itself designated as a protected structure and
stretches the entire way around the present-day park. It is eleven
kilometres long and three metres high. The wall also supports its
own particular flora.

The park is open all year round, there is no admission charge and
visitors can explore freely.


Bus Route(s): No's 10, 25, 37, 38, 39, 66, 67 from city
centre.


Each of the vehicular gates into Phoenix Park has a
gatekeeper’s lodge as part of the entrance cluster.


The cache is a magnetic nano container so BYOP. Please handle
container gently.

STAGE 1


Obtain the number engraved on the stonework over the front door
of the lodge.

ANSWER = ABCD

STAGE 2


Obtain the number engraved on the stonework over the front door
of this small building which was built as a GAOL for the
“Ladies of the Night” who frequented the area in olden
times. There are some cells submerged in the ground adjacant to
this building.


ANSWER = EFGH


FINAL STAGE


N53.20.(A+B)(B-C)(A+C+D)


W06.EF.(G-H)H(A+E+H)

Additional Waypoints

ST27V18 - Stage 1
N 53° 20.912 W 006° 17.816

SU27V18 - Stage 2
N 53° 20.903 W 006° 17.827

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Found while out with Cristina. Took a bit of coaxing to get the log out of the cache, but luckily I have long nails. TFTC

I was appearing as a witness in a murder trial in the Central Ciminal Court and since I was a little early managed to snag this one before turning up at the appointed time. Took a while to extract it from the container, would recommend tweezers,
TNLN TFTC

Great park...I can't get over how HUGE it is! If you're going to do all the caches here you should definitely drive or rent a bike! Also, the park is always busy (it was pretty chilly when we were there and there were folks running, walking, playing cricket...) so you have to watch out for muggles. TFTC! CheerGU :)
